meanings.definition: A sound of excitement or joy.
meanings.sent1: The children's laughter filled the playground with whee.
meanings.sent2: I heard a loud whee coming from the roller coaster.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's tail wagging created a whee of happiness.
meanings.sent4: The colorful balloons floating in the sky seemed to dance to the tune of whee.
meanings.sent5: The birthday party was full of whee and happiness.

meanings.definition: To make a high-pitched, excited sound.
meanings.sent1: The toddler would whee with joy whenever he saw bubbles.
meanings.sent2: The excited fans started to whee as their favorite band took the stage.
meanings.sent3: The kitten would whee playfully while chasing a toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The wind made the trees whee softly in the night.
meanings.sent5: The whistle of the train began to whee as it approached the station.

meanings.definition: An exclamation of delight or amusement.
meanings.sent1: Whee! That was a fun ride at the amusement park.
meanings.sent2: Whee, look at the cute puppies playing in the park!
meanings.sent3: Whee, the magician pulled a rabbit out of the hat!
meanings.sent4: The children shouted whee as they ran through the sprinklers.
meanings.sent5: Whee, the surprise party was a success!
